html: Isaiah 32:19. When—Or, rather, And it shall hail — As my blessings shall be poured down upon my people, who, from a wilderness, are turned into a fruitful field, so my judgments (which are signified byhail, Isaiah 28:2; Isaiah 28:17 , and elsewhere) shall fall upon them who were a fruitful field, but are turned into a forest, as was said Isaiah 32:15; that is, upon the unbelieving and rebellious Jews. And the city—Jerusalem, which, though now it was the seat of God’s worship and people, yet he foresaw would be the great enemy of the Messiah;shall be low in a low place—Hebrew, תשׁפל בשׁפלה , shall be humbled with humiliation; that is, shall be greatly humbled, orbrought very low.
